Our functional responses analysis of global satellite observations from the Global Inventory Modeling and Mapping Studies (GIMMS3g
5 ) shows the spatial dependence of vegetation cover on temperature ( Fig. 1), with low maximum foliage cover in colder regions (low SWI 5) and high maximum foliage cover in warmer regions. We examined the 95 th percentile of the distribution of annual F max ( F 95, %), which characterizes the maximum F max attained globally for a given annual SWI 5. We delineated the regions where temperature strongly affected F max, and found it depended linearly on SWI 5 under colder conditions ( Fig. 1).
